questions.question: 1. Which method is commonly used to confirm the successful cloning of the GFP gene into the expression vector?
2. Which method is commonly used for the amplification of the GFP gene during cloning?
3. What is the purpose of a selectable marker in an expression vector used for GFP cloning?

answers.b: To regulate the expression of GFP gene
answers.c: To facilitate purification of GFP protein
answers.d: To enable selection of cells containing the vector

questions.question: 4. Which class of enzymes is commonly used for DNA ligation during GFP gene cloning?
5. Which region of the GFP gene is responsible for the protein's fluorescent properties?
6. What is the primary purpose of using an expression vector in cloning the GFP gene?

answers.a: To inhibit the host cell's growth
answers.b: To act as a vehicle to transport the foreign gene into the host cell
answers.c: To degrade the host cell's DNA
answers.d: To stop cell division in the host

questions.question: 7. Which method is used to monitor the cutting and joining reactions of the vector and GFP gene?
8. What is the function of the ligation reaction in the cloning process?

answers.a: To cut the DNA into smaller pieces
answers.b: To join the GFP gene to the vector DNA

questions.question: 9. What is the purpose of an origin of replication (ori) in an expression vector?

answers.a: To initiate transcription of the GFP gene
answers.b: To provide a site for restriction enzyme binding
answers.c: To allow the vector to replicate within the host cell
answers.d: To facilitate the ligation of the GFP gene into the vector
